course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Exploration of Chinese Calligraphy
course.description: Chinese Calligraphy is one of the most unique traditional art forms in Asia. This course will develop students' appreciation of various types of Chinese Calligraphy. The course provides practical writing workshops which can encourage students’ interest and experience the progress; deepen students’ understanding basic calligraphic skill and generate visual creativity. It prepares students having a better overview of Chinese culture.
course.prerequisites: a passing letter grade in LANG 1401 OR LANG 1402 OR LANG 1403 OR LANG 1404 OR LANG 1002 (prior to 2022-23)

reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor is nice and talkative.
He usually asks questions during classes.
Students are required to comments their own works in front of the class after midterm and final.
reviews.comment_grading:
As the grades of the second midterm and final are not released, but I guess my grade may be above or equal to means. The final grade is acceptable for me. As I haven't learnt about Chinese calligraphy before.
Final grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload:
There are only 3 assignments in total. Students only need to hand in 5 practice sheets in each assignment.
but if you enrol this course, you need to practice a lot before each exam.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. is nice.
Would be interesting if you enjoy sharing ideas and commenting your own work in front of the whole class :)
But prof. allows us to sleep in class, so you can say the lessons are chill.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good grade I guess. Can only view the grade of the first midterm tho as the grades of the second midterm and the final project are not released.
First midterm: 13.6/20
Mean is around 12.x/20
Final grade: A
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of the 2 assignments preparing for the midterms are ok. But the one for the final project is very heavy, I spent around 20 hours to complete it.
